sub_topic: Identification of the presence of specific functional groups in a compound using UV-Vis spectroscopy
message_1: "What specific functional group is present in a compound if the UV-Vis spectroscopy analysis reveals an absorption peak at 170-180 nm?"
message_2: An absorption peak at 170-180 nm in UV-Vis spectroscopy is characteristic of compounds with isolated double bonds (C=C) or isolated triple bonds (Câ‰¡C). These functional groups are found in alkenes and alkynes, respectively. The presence of such a peak suggests that the compound contains one of these functional groups.
